glosses: To reproach or shame someone sharply for a mistake; to cast something in someone's teeth, to rub someone's nose in something.

etymology: Derived from Ottoman Turkish یوزه اورمق (yüze urmak, vurmak, “to throw a thing in the face, to reproach”), equivalent to compound of yüz (“face”) + -ü (possessive suffix) + -(n)e (dative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant) + vurmak (“to hit, to strike”), literally “to hit in someone's face (with something)”.
